intro: Dorstenia kameruniana, commonly known as the Cameroon spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Dorstenia kameruniana is often found in shaded, moist environments and is adapted to thrive in the understory of dense forests.
